title: Collage, "Design for Printed Textile-Quatrafoil, Series #625-630", 1954
medium: Colored tissue paper, black construction paper, graphite on tracing paper
inscribed: Verso: in graphite, upper left corner: VI-7
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Four petaled flowers made from pink and blue tissue and black construction paper arranged in vertical rows

tombstone.epitaph:
Collage, "Design for Printed Textile-Quatrafoil, Series #625-630", 1954.
1954. Colored tissue paper, black construction paper, graphite on tracing paper. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-244.
